issue.title: deb_resolve cache not invalidated by manifest change in Bazel 8.0.0

repository.name: rules_distroless
repository.description: Bazel rules to construct images using https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/distroless

issue.body:
Raising an issue to track compatibility problems with Bazel 8.0.0.

The following flag defaults have been flipped:

* --incompatible_no_implicit_watch_label (https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/23861; now defaults to true)
* --incompatible_use_plus_in_repo_names (https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/23127; now defaults to true)

This causes issues in `apt/private/deb_resolve.bzl`. The lack of `rctx.watch` means changes to the manifest are not causing cache invalidation. The second breaks the `:lock` `--autofix` and printed command.

Proposed fixes in: https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/rules_distroless/pull/145

issue.title: [Bug]: `npm_translate_lock` repository not invalidated when lockfile changes with Bazel 8

repository.name: rules_js
repository.description: High-performance Bazel rules for running Node.js tools and building JavaScript projects

issue.body:
### What happened?

When using Bazel 8, it seems like the repository that is generated by `npm_translate_lock` does not get updated if changes are made to the `pnpm-lock.yaml` file.

Minimal reproduction: https://github.com/glindstedt/rules_js_bazel_8_minimal_repro/tree/main

This can be mitigated by adding this to `.bazelrc`:
```
common --noincompatible_no_implicit_watch_label
```
The flag was flipped in Bazel 8: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/23861

### Version

Development (host) and target OS/architectures: linux

Output of `bazel --version`: 8.1.1

Version of the Aspect rules, or other relevant rules from your
`WORKSPACE` or `MODULE.bazel` file:
* rules_js: 1.42.3

### Any other information?
